text: the ANC is the oldest liberation party
in Africa founded just two years after
South Africa was united into one country
after the borough war which is pulled by
an Afrikaans word apartheid apartheid is
formalized demonstrations against the
South African government strict
apartheid policies the ANC is banned
shortly after the Sharpeville massacre
of 69 black people and a radical Nelson
Mandela forms its military wing Umkhonto
was seized with Jacob Zuma joins that it
is useless and futile for us to continue
talking peace and non-violence
a year later Mandela is arrested put on
trial for treason and sentenced to life
in Robben Island large cards gather to
watch the accused being driven away to
start their life sentences after 27
years in jail Mandela's released given
the Nobel Peace Prize and goes on to
become South Africa's first black
president advocating reconciliation
tobon Becky
takes over from Mandela ANC support
peaks at nearly 70% of the vote
charismatic popular Zuma is his deputy
June 2005
Zoomers fired after he's linked to fraud
involving his financial advisor and
charged with corruption the charges are
later dropped separately he's also
acquitted of rape in December 2007 his
comeback after a bitter contest he's
elected party president and moves
against Becky forcing him to stand down
in 2009 Zuma becomes president of South
Africa but ANC support stops dropping
and rivals emerge
Zoomers key ally Julius Malema starts
his own party the EMF and the once white
democratic alliance gain black support
the last few months have left Jacob Zuma
embattled
with allegations that he allowed
controversial businessman the Gupta
brothers to influence political
decisions the Constitutional Court found
he used government money to renovate his
private home now it looks like 783
corruption charges against him could be
reinstated and the latest scandal media
claims that the stretched police budget
was used to buy 10 luxury vehicles for
president Zoomers five wives
